package.name: Solar
package.summary: Simple object library and application repository for PHP.
package.description:
Solar is a class library and application component suite for PHP 5 (and is PHP5 E_STRICT compliant). Solar provides simple, easy-to-comprehend classes and components for the common aspects of web-based rapid application development.
Solar is designed for developers who intend to distribute their applications to the whole world. This means, for example, the database driver functions work exactly the same way for each supported database. It also means that localization support is built in from the start.
Please visit http://solarphp.com/ for more information.
package.notes:
* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* WARNING: This release contains backwards compatibility (BC) breaks.
* New classes:
* Solar_Debug_Var, to capture var_dump() output
* Solar:
* Solar::dump() now uses an instance of Solar_Debug_Var
* BC BREAK: Removed undocumented Solar::scrub() method
* BC BREAK: Removed undocumented Solar::super() method
* Solar_Super:
* Extends Solar_Base the way it should have from the beginning
* Only allows access to underscore-prefixed superglobals, except $_REQUEST (you should use $_GET or $_POST, don't be lazy ;-)
* Now uses internal scrub() method and array_walk_recursive() instead of undocumented Solar::scrub() method (which has been removed)
* Solar_Debug_Timer:
* Changed config key 'html' to 'output' to be consistent with Solar_Debug_Var (as other output modes may become available)
* Removed $html parameter from display()
* Added localization strings
* Solar_Uri (BC BREAKS):
* BC BREAK: Removed multi-action method query() in favor of addQuery(), setQuery(), and setQueryString()
* BC BREAK: Removed multi-action method info() in favor of setInfo() and setInfoString()
* Updated all applications using these previous methods

release.notes:
* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* WARNING: This release contains backwards compatibility (BC) breaks.
* New classes:
* Solar_Debug_Var, to capture var_dump() output
* Solar:
* Solar::dump() now uses an instance of Solar_Debug_Var
* BC BREAK: Removed undocumented Solar::scrub() method
* BC BREAK: Removed undocumented Solar::super() method
* Solar_Super:
* Extends Solar_Base the way it should have from the beginning
* Only allows access to underscore-prefixed superglobals, except $_REQUEST (you should use $_GET or $_POST, don't be lazy ;-)
* Now uses internal scrub() method and array_walk_recursive() instead of undocumented Solar::scrub() method (which has been removed)
* Solar_Debug_Timer:
* Changed config key 'html' to 'output' to be consistent with Solar_Debug_Var (as other output modes may become available)
* Removed $html parameter from display()
* Added localization strings
* Solar_Uri (BC BREAKS):
* BC BREAK: Removed multi-action method query() in favor of addQuery(), setQuery(), and setQueryString()
* BC BREAK: Removed multi-action method info() in favor of setInfo() and setInfoString()
* Updated all applications using these previous methods
